news.title: Trump says Nato's new 5% defence spending pledge a 'big win'
news.summary: Nato leaders meeting in The Hague say they have an "ironclad commitment to collective defence".

news.title: Man guilty of murdering schoolboy, 14, in Hainault sword attack
news.summary: Daniel Anjorin was attacked with a sword while he was on his way to school in north-east London.

news.title: 'He's just killed that boy': Police video shows how Hainault attack unfolded
news.summary: Marcus Monzo, 37, has been found guilty of of murdering Daniel Anjorin and attempting to kill three others.

news.title: Watch: BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from inside Iran
news.summary: Lyse Doucet reports from the streets of Tehran, where she says things are staring to return to normal.

news.title: What are the government's planned welfare cuts and how much will they save?
news.summary: Labour MPs have threatened to vote against the government's welfare reform proposals.

news.title: Man arrested over 1980s sex attacks days after BBC questions police
news.summary: Days before the BBC was due to broadcast its documentary police arrested a man over claims by two of the women.

news.title: Eurostar passengers face severe delays after cable theft
news.summary: The rail operator says that repairs are now complete but lines are open, but delays will last until the end of the day.

news.title: Crowds pour in as Glastonbury Festival gates open
news.summary: Sir Michael and Emily Eavis welcome hundreds of punters to "the most joyful city in the UK".

news.title: Gareth Southgate 'not missing' being England manager as he gets knighthood
news.summary: Sir Gareth Southgate says he does not miss managing England after being knighted for his services to football.

news.title: Temperatures above 30C expected as a second June heatwave looms
news.summary: Another heatwave could be on the way this week as temperatures are set to soar.
